title: 3 Simple Ways to Disable Auto-Emoji on Discord

steps.title: Open the Discord app.
steps.content: Open the Discord app. This looks like Discord's mascot, Wumbus, with a blue-purple background. Disabling this feature on the mobile app will also disable it everywhere else you're signed in , such as the desktop app or website.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This is in the bottom-right corner, near You . If you don't see the bottom icons, swipe right to exit the chat or server screen.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. You can find this in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Chat.
steps.content: Tap Chat . This is under the App Settings header; you may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Toggle off "Automatically convert emoticons in your messages to emoji".
steps.content: Toggle off "Automatically convert emoticons in your messages to emoji". This option is under the Emoji header; you may need to scroll down to find it. The switch will turn grey. When this is disabled, you can type emoticons such as ":)" without it converting into an emoji.

steps.title: Open Discord.
steps.content: Open Discord. This looks like Discord's mascot, Wumbus, with a blue-purple background. You can use this method for the desktop app for Windows and Mac computers. If you toggle this setting off on desktop, it will also apply everywhere else you're signed in, such as the mobile app.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . This gear icon is at the bottom-left corner, next to your username. User Settings will open.

steps.title: Click Chat.
steps.content: Click Chat . It's under the "App Settings" header.

steps.title: Toggle off "Automatically convert emoticons in your messages to emoji".
steps.content: Toggle off "Automatically convert emoticons in your messages to emoji". The switch will turn grey. When this is disabled, you can type emoticons such as ":)" without it converting into an emoji.

steps.title: Open Discord and navigate to where you want to enter your message.
steps.content: Open Discord and navigate to where you want to enter your message. Tap the app icon that looks like a smiling controller. Use this method if you want to temporarily stop your text from automatically turning into emoji.

steps.title: Enter \ before your emoticon text.
steps.content: Enter \ before your emoticon text. To stop Discord from automatically changing your emoticons into emoji, enter a backslash. You'll have to repeat this step, using the backslash, every time you enter an emoticon. [1] X Research source
